page.title: 02CUSTOMS AND MEDIA
page.content: This area maintains local traditions. There is a pantomime in St.Stephens every year,and annually a Feast week held in both St.Stephens and Coombe. At these festivals a Carnival Queen is chosen after the local girls have been judged in a competition in which they wear special costumes.A good costume can cost upto three hundred pounds,but the winner gets money as a prize to help pay for it.{Local News}The typical newspaper stories about the St.Stephens/Coombe area today are not very exciting :little happens here which is of national significance. Most events are small and of interest only locally. Typical news,coffee mornings,appeals, bingo,Church info. sport,gossip,adverts .Recently nearby St.Dennis Church burnt down and made national news,TV and newspapers.
